calls.example:
random()      -- random number between 0 and 1
random(3)     -- random number between 0 and 3

arguments.description: The array to randomly select an item from
arguments.name: arr

doc.description: Round a number to the nearest integer
doc.name: round

doc.description:
floor is a function that takes in a number, and returns the greatest integer less or equal to x
see here
doc.name: floor

_return.description: greatest integer less than or equals to x

doc.description:
ceil is a function that takes in a number, and returns the smallest integer greater or equal to x
see here
doc.name: ceil

doc.description:
Return the smallest value.
Can also take any number of arguments, or a table.
doc.name: min
examples:
min(6, 7); -- returns 6

min(6, 7, 4); -- returns 4

min({ 6, 7, 4 }); -- returns 4

doc.description:
Return the largest value.
Can also take any number of arguments, or a table.
doc.name: max
examples:
max(2, 5); -- returns 5

max(2, 5, 7); -- returns 7

max({ 2, 5, 7 }); -- returns 7

doc.description:
Returns the absolute value of x
see here
doc.name: abs

_return.description: The absolote value of the input

doc.description: Maps x from an original range to a target range
doc.name: map

arguments.description: The start of the initial range
arguments.name: start

arguments.description: The end of the initial range
arguments.name: end

arguments.description: The start of the target range
arguments.name: target_start

arguments.description: The end of the target range
arguments.name: target_end

examples:
local mouseX_mapped = map(mouseX, 0, width, 0, 100);
-- mapped mouseX between 0 and 100

doc.description: Calculates the distance between 2 points in 2D or 3D space
doc.name: dist

arguments.description: The x coordinate of the first point
arguments.name: x1

arguments.description: The y coordinate of the first point
arguments.name: y1

arguments.description: The x coordinate of the second point
arguments.name: x2

arguments.description: The y coordinate of the second point
arguments.name: y2

arguments.description: The x coordinate of the first point
arguments.name: x1

arguments.description: The y coordinate of the first point
arguments.name: y1

arguments.description: The z coordinate of the first point
arguments.name: z1

arguments.description: The x coordinate of the second point
arguments.name: x2

arguments.description: The y coordinate of the second point
arguments.name: y2

arguments.description: The z coordinate of the second point
arguments.name: z2

doc.description: Limits x to a minimum and maximum value
doc.name: constrain
